RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 6F Turf CR: 86. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Six Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISCHIEVOUS ANGEL broke last but one, dropped back under some urging then settled well off the pace, was roused in the two path on the turn, swung five wide into upper stretch, rallied outside under a left-handed crop, closed strongly to get the lead at the sixteenth-pole, fought with the runner-up to the finish and prevailed under good handling. BEER RUN went to the front, set the pace under some pressure, vied inside of a rival while along the rail on the turn, was asked near the five-sixteenths, came under a drive under heavy pressure in upper stretch, battled with FLAT TOP BOX into the final furlong, lost the lead to the winner at the sixteenth-pole, fought on to the finish but missed while clear for the place. FLAT TOP BOX pressed the pace on the outside then in the two path on the turn, was given his cue in the three path into the stretch, battled on even terms for the front into the final furlong, swapped leads back and forth shortly thereafter, dropped back into the final sixteenth and weakened but held the show. FAST BOAT TO SKYE was rated just off the pace, went around the turn in the three path, was roused coming to the five-sixteenths, chased four wide into the stretch, pursued the leaders under a drive into the final furlong, swapped back to his inside lead while dropping back at the sixteenth-pole and also weakened. AMERICAN KNOW HOW was hustled from the gate then angled in, pressed the pace on the inside of the leader, hit the rail nearing the half-mile pole then steadied and dropped back, saved ground on the turn, was asked at the five-sixteenths, dropped back into upper stretch and came up empty. INSPECTOR POIROT (IRE) was slow into stride, dropped well behind the rest of the field, rounded the turn in the two path and was eased but walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Inspector Poirot (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow into stride,well behind,2path turn,trailed,eased,wlkd off

ENTRY.NAME: American Know How
ENTRY.OWNER: Reagan Jack Racing Hickey John M McKenna Michael and Pepe Anthony T
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,angled in,pressed,hit rail1/2,stdied,ins turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Beer Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,ins turn,ask5/16,2p1/4,collared1/16,fought on

ENTRY.NAME: Fast Boat to Skye
ENTRY.OWNER: Alifyfe Racing LLC and Mawaka Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated just off pace,3path turn,asked 5/16,4p1/4,ins lead1/16,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Mischievous Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Brant Peter M and Parkland Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk last but one,drp back,settled,ask 2p trn,5p1/4,rallied,up1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Top Box
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed outside,vied 2p turn,3p1/4,even terms3/16,wknd last1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PHOTON bobbled at the start, recovered to race three then two wide in pursuit, took closer order on the once spurting away leader three furlongs from home, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and took over command swinging three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive inching away to the finish kept to task. STARTS NOW got bumped between foes and pinched back at the break conceding two to three lengths to the front, tracked the pace along the inside until tipped out three wide near the three-eighths floating out BERNING HONOR four wide, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick to secure the place honors. BOMB SQUAD broke in at the start bumping a trio and squeezing them back in concert with THE SPLENDID ONE, who broke outwards, tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled three wide into upper stretch and improved position to procure the show honors. NORTH END LADY three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, tipped out four wide into upper stretch and kept on to the finish. THE SPLENDID ONE broke out at the start bumping and squeezing back a trio in concert with BOMB SQUAD who broke inwards from outside those rivals, assumed command and spurted away in hand just off the inside opening a commanding lead through sensible splits, had the field take closer order through the far turn and came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, yielded the front spinning just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. BERNING HONOR got bumped between foes solidly and was squeezed back at the start conceding three to four lengths to the front, chased along the inside, tipped to the two path half a mile from home, then got carried out four wide at the three-eighths as STARTS NOW tipped out along her inside at that station, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and offered no response. STONE OF DESTINY got bumped solidly between foes and was squeezed back at the break conceding three to four lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: The Splendid One
ENTRY.OWNER: Brodsky Alan and Hennig Mark A
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, spurted away 2p, to ins 1/2, yielded 2w 1/4, wknd lte

ENTRY.NAME: Starts Now
ENTRY.OWNER: Bloom Racing Stable LLC (Jeffrey Bloom) America's Pastime Stables and Krakow Rac
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump betw, pinched st, tracked ins, tip 3w 3/8, 5w uppr, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Berning Honor
ENTRY.OWNER: Rosenthal, Robert D. and Bernstein, Bradford H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp btw, squeezed st, ins, floated 4w 3/8, 5-6w uppr, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Stone of Destiny
ENTRY.OWNER: Alifyfe Racing LLC and Mawaka Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump betw, squeezed st, tracked 2p, 4w upper, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Bomb Squad
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, tracked ins, coaxed 3/8, angled 3w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: North End Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, angled 4w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Photon
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w pursuit, advanced 3/8, up 3w upper, dug in, inched away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 28000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Other wise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OH DONNA broke through the front of the gate prior to the start then was brought back around and reloaded, came away alertly and went straight to the front, showed the way with company to her outside, vied inside while still inside of a foe on the turn, passed the quarter-pole under urging, shook clear under a left-handed crop inside the furlong marker and proved best under a strong hand-ride in the final sixteenth. K D KAKES broke in and bumped with a foe, moved up to press the pace on the outside, drew even with the leader inside the three-quarter pole, vied in the two path on the turn, spun three wide into the stretch under urging, fought outside of the winner under a drive into the final furlong and was outfinished but just held the place. HANDLE THE TRUTH was well placed just off the pace, dropped back in the two path on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive, gained in the final furlong and finished willingly to just miss the place while narrowly up for the show. SAVE GRACE was hustled from the gate, chased the pace on the outside then three wide on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch, kept on in pursuit of the top two in the final furlong and just missed the trifecta. JOEY THE FISH bumped with a rival at the start, dropped well behind under strong urging, went two then three wide on the turn, swung five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. RICELLE lugged in early, moved up inside the three-quarter pole then was taken in hand, came under urging in the three then four path on the turn, dropped to the three path into the stretch then drifted further in and capitulated. ACCEL ROSE was hustled from the gate then settled off the pace, dropped back along the rail under urging on the turn, moved out in upper stretch and had nothing left.

ENTRY.NAME: Accel Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,settled,dropped back rail turn,mvd out 3/16,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Handle the Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,dropped back 2path turn,gained late,willingly,miss2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Joey the Fish
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,dropped well behind,2-3p turn,5p1/4,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: K D Kakes
ENTRY.OWNER: Nentwig Michael Rochfort John McLean Ian and Pagano Ray
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bmp,pressed outside,2p turn,3p1/4,ouitfinished,held2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Oh Donna
ENTRY.OWNER: Twin Sports Racing and Adelphi Racing Club
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk thru gate,awy alertly,pace ins foe,ins,respnd,clr ins1/8,best

ENTRY.NAME: Ricelle
ENTRY.COMMENT: lugged in early,mvd up 3/4,in hand,ask3-4w trn,drift in3/16,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Save Grace
ENTRY.OWNER: Caruso Michael J and Dubb Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,chased outside,3w turn,4w1/4,kept on,missed trifecta

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 7F Turf CR: 92. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 85000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due AtTi me Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUSE established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside under some pressure from the presence of ROUGH DRAFT to the outside, remained patiently handled until set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, inched away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in and held well to prevail. ROUGH DRAFT prompted the pace of RUSE from the outside three then two wide coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick but was ultimately repelled to the finish. PHANTOM SMOKE broke out at the start and was corrected, tucked after the start directly in front of WHAT'S UP BRO forcing that rival to check off his heels near the six and a half, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued three to four wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. GHOST GIANT three then two wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun three wide into upper stretch and kept on to the finish. YARROW chased along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, continued in the inside route into upper stretch, stayed on one paced to the wire. WHAT'S UP BRO broke out at the start and was corrected, then got checked off the heels of PHANTOM SMOKE as that rival took over his lane directly in front near the six and a half furlong marker, chased three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide for home and offered no response. ME 'N SAP chased along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, continued in the inside route into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. BAR FOURTEEN coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside under a ride from the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Yarrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed near 1/4, ins 1/4, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Me 'n Sap
ENTRY.OWNER: Brady Horse Racing and Rusba V Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed near 1/4, ins 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Bar Fourteen
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Ghost Giant
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: What's Up Bro
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, checked after st, chased 3w, 4w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Phantom Smoke
ENTRY.OWNER: Roman Lawrence P Anthony George CT Racing and Emerald Upstate Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, 3-4w upper, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Ruse
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, set down inside 1/4, inched away, dug in, held well

ENTRY.NAME: Rough Draft
ENTRY.OWNER: Clear Stars Stable Mitre Box Stable and Big Toe Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 3-2w, coaxed near 1/4, 2w 1/4p, mild kick, repelled

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 87. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DONEGAL FOREVER stumbled significantly on the third stride from the gate and had the rider lose his left iron, regained the iron just before leaving the chute, settled comfortably off the pace, drafted in the two path on the turn, shifted four wide while asked at the quarter-pole, rallied to the lead in upper stretch, shook clear under two pops of a left-handed crop inside the furlong marker and proved much the best while eased up late. SHREVEPORT stalked the pace on the far outside, moved in late on the backstretch, was given his cue in the four path on the turn, came five wide into the stretch under a drive and just earned the place while no match for the winner. RIDE UP contested the pace while well out in the track, moved in late on the backstretch, vied in the three path on the turn, led under urging into upper stretch then lost the advantage to the winner, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened then lost the place while clear for the show. CLOUD FOREST was hustled from the start, moved up while extending stride near the seven-eighths pole, took the lead inside the three-quarter pole, vied in the two path on the turn, lost the advantage at the five-sixteenths, dropped back into upper stretch and tired. PHELPSY was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, settled at the rear, was roused two then three wide on the turn, swung five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. MARTY'S MAGIC was hustled from the gate, contested the pace on the inside of rivals, chased along the rail on the turn and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Cloud Forest
ENTRY.OWNER: Wygod Martin J Wygod Pam and Bushnell Emily
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,mvd up 7/8,lead ins3/4,2p turn,headed5/16,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Marty's Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pace inside foes,chased rail turn,retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Ride Up
ENTRY.OWNER: Snyder Richard Snyder Connie Hoppel Jesse Setzer Brett and KEM Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace,well out in track,mvd in 9/16,3path turn,led5/16-3/16,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Shreveport
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked far outside,mvd in 7/16,asked 4wide turn,5w1/4,up 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Donegal Forever
ENTRY.COMMENT: stmbld aftr st,lost left iron brief,settld,2p,4p1/4,rally,easd up

ENTRY.NAME: Phelpsy
ENTRY.OWNER: Lawrence William H Drown Jeffrey Three Chimneys Farm LLC (Goncalo B Torrealba) a
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow,settled at rear,roused 2-3p turn,5w1/4,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 98. Claiming Purse 55000. INNER TURF FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessme nt Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FRONT MAN tracked the pace along the inside through the first turn and down the backstretch, tipped two then three wide through the far turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch, rallied on near even terms a furlong out before taking command near the sixteenth marker, then inched away to the finish to prevail. LANDBISCUIT tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, rallied to take command at the three-sixteenths, dug in head to head getting displaced from the front near the sixteenth pole, ran on willingly to the finish. BE HERE stumbled at the start, raced along the inside through the first turn before chasing two then three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick to latch on the top pair as they hit the finish. KLICKITAT hustled from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside briefly headed for the front when GOLDINI pulled his way to command six and a half furlongs from home, quickly took back the front inside that station, came under coaxing nearing the quarter pole and cut the corner into upper stretch under threat, yielded command with three-sixteenths to go, then weakened in the late stages. GOLDINI three wide through the first turn under a rating hold, pulled his way advancing on the front when in the clear into the backstretch to take brief command six and a half furlongs from home, settled back tipped four wide to be just off the top pair before tucking three wide five furlongs from home, came under coaxing near the midway point on the far turn and bid three wide advancing again into contention before swinging three wide into upper stretch, then weakened in the drive. AMERICAN LINCOLN just off the inside tracking the front, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch and tired. MOUNT TRAVERS forwardly placed just off the inside in closest aim of the leader, was briefly relegated to be just off pair when GOLDINI advanced briefly to the front before settling back in closest aim of KLICKITAT, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, retreated with five-sixteenths to go and continued just off the inside into upper stretch, then tired through to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Front Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Krakow Racing LLC and America's Pastime Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed 2-3w 3/8, 4w upper, up near 1/16, inched away

ENTRY.NAME: Klickitat
ENTRY.OWNER: JohLis Racing LLC and Daly Double Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, in hand ins, coax 1/4, cut corner, yielded, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Landbiscuit
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed near 1/4, 2w 1/4p, up 3/16, collared, willing

ENTRY.NAME: Be Here
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Goldini
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez, Rudy R. and Imperio, Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 1st turn, pulled 7F, up 6 1/2, bid 3w 3/8, 3w uppr, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Mount Travers
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed 2p, coaxed 3/8, retreated, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: American Lincoln
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed along 7/16, angled 3-4w upper, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Purse 80000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OCEAN'S RESERVE was rated just off the pace, came under urging in the two path on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive, chased under a right-handed crop into the final furlong, gained to make a bid inside the embattled leaders into the final sixteenth and got up under good handling to prevail. ALWAYS CHARMING moved his head just before the gate opened and was last to commence, was rated just off the pace, went three then four wide on the turn, was roused late on that bend, made a five wide bid into the stretch, drifted in some while battling outside of MARIACHI outside the sixteenth-pole, fought with two foes to the finish and missed while just able to get the place. MARIACHI attended the pace on the outside, vied in the four then three path on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch, drifted in some while dueling with ALWAYS CHARMING outside the sixteenth-pole, fought between foes to the finish and just missed the place while clear for the show. TOMMY GUN was hustled from the gate then set a joint pace, vied inside while asked on the turn, spun three wide into the stretch under the crop, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. BRACIOLE settled off the pace, was roused four wide on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and failed to respond. DR. MARBOOZ dropped well behind under urging then angled in, went three then two wide on the turn and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean's Reserve
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated just off pace,asked 2path turn,chsd,gain,bid 1/16,prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Tommy Gun
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pace,asked rail turn,3path into lane,drop back1/8,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Always Charming
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved head brk,last away,rated,3-4p turn,bid5w1/4,led,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Braciole
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, roused 4wide turn, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Dr. Marbooz
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,angled in,3-2path turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Mariachi
ENTRY.OWNER: Broman Sr Chester and Broman Mary
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside pace,4-3path turn,4path1/4,fought on,missed2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1M Turf CR: 94. Allowance Purse 95000. (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EXACT ESTIMATE three wide in pursuit from mid pack, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung four wide into upper stretch, came in a path straightened away taking the three path and nudging SOULMATE to the two path, then came in another path a furlong out taking the two path, dug in under a drive rallying to issue a challenge through to the finish getting up in the final jumps to score. KAWHI ME A RIVER forwardly placed just off the inside early on, advanced to take command with six and a half furlongs to run, tucked to the inside with five and a half furlongs remaining and showed the way along the inside in hand, came under light coaxing at the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under threat to the finish and was caught in the final strides while running on willingly to the wire. AL'S ROCKET tracked the pace just off the inside from near the rear of the field, tipped three wide at the half mile pole floating DANZIGWITHTHESTARS four wide into the far turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick to secure the show honors. SHUTTERS broke a half a beat slow, tracked the front just off the inside from just off the pace, came under brief coaxing and took the inside route into upper stretch moving around the backing away EMBOITE, was along the inside initially with clearance and had it seal up when EXACT ESTIMATE drifted inwards, hopped when along the fence just inside the eighth pole on pause lacking room in behind KAWHI ME A RIVER, then got steadied briefly a sixteenth from home before being able to tip out late missing for the show honors. DANZIGWITHTHESTARS fractious in the gate prior to the start, chased three wide until nudged four wide at the half mile pole by AL'S ROCKET, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled seven wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild bid but was outkicked. SOULMATE three then two wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, got nudged to the two path straightened away and weakened to the finish. EMBOITE (IRE) coaxed from the gate, showed the way early on along the inside until headed near the six and a half furlong marker, got taken in hand and was eased off six furlongs out settling to track along the inside, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, faded nearing the quarter pole and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, then weakened in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Danzigwiththestars
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, 3-4w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 7w upper, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Al's Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, tipped 3w 1/2, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Emboite (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, led early ins, eased off 3/4, faded, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Shutters
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 slw, tracked 2p, ins 1/4, lacked room ins, steady 1/16p

ENTRY.NAME: Kawhi Me a River
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p in aim, up 6 1/2, to ins 5 1/2, cut corner, edged away, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Soulmate
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, nudged 2p 3/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Exact Estimate
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed near 1/4, 4w upper, rallied, up final jumps

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Bed o' Roses S. - Grade2 BELMONT PARK RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 100. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 each which should accompany the nomination. $1,000 to pass the entry box and an addition al $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to s econd, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake in 2022-23 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstakes in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of two races other than maiden,c laiming, starter or State-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 3 with 18 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOODNIGHT OLIVE came away in front, was eased back off the pace nearing the three-quarter pole then moved out, was rated under light restraint, drafted inside to the two path on the turn, shifted four wide while asked at the quarter-pole, rallied outside under a left-handed crop, closed well to get the lead coming to the sixteenth-pole, battled outside of two foes to the wire and prevailed under strong handling. WICKED HALO pressed the pace on the outside of the leader, vied in the two path on the turn, took a narrow advantage inside the three-eighths, lost the lead while asked for her best in upper stretch, fought back gamely in the final furlong and just missed while able to get the place. CARAMEL SWIRL brushed with an opponent at the start, was rated just off the pace on the outside, ranged up four wide on the turn, made a bid inside the three-eighths, took the lead while set down in upper stretch, led under a drive until just before the sixteenth-pole then was headed by the winner, fought between foes to the wire and missed while well clear for the show. DR B brushed with a rival at the start, chased the pace down the backstretch, went three wide on the turn, dropped back late on that bend, spun five wide into the stretch and capitulated. BEGUINE was hustled to the front, set the pace while inside of a foe, vied along the rail on the turn, lost the lead inside the three-eighths, dropped back into the stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Goodnight Olive
ENTRY.OWNER: First Row Partners and Team Hanley
ENTRY.COMMENT: eased back 3/4,mvd out,rated,ins-2p turn,4p1/4,rallied,up1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 10 6F Inner turf CR: 73. Claiming Purse 41000. INNER TURF (UP TO $7,134 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000 (1.5% Aftercare Ass essment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUM RUNNER READY tracked the pace along the inside from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch, tipped out when able nearing the eighth pole and rallied to issue a challenge through the final sixteenth to get up in the last jumps to the wire in a blanket finish. SMOKIN' HOT KITTY got bumped at the start by FULIGNI, who broke outwards, raced four then three wide in pursuit from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive closing late and just missed at the end. CANDY MONET dueled six paths off the inside down the backstretch with FAST COREY to her inside before darting to the three then two path into the turn, knocked heads through the bend widening away as a pair from the rest of the field and coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, got let out swinging three wide into upper stretch, shook away from her main pace rival nearing the eighth pole, dug in under threat from a host of pursuers closing to the finish and was nailed in the final strides by a pair while just preserving the show honors on the wire. QUEENS OVER THREES chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive closing in late and missed at the end. QUICK POWER NAP broke out at the start and was corrected, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, rallied and missed at the end. MOSTLY HARMLESS chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid but was outfinished. SUSIE'S SAVER chased three wide until tucked inside half a mile from home, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch, made headway but was outkicked. FULIGNI broke out at the start bumping SMOKIN' HOT KITTY, chased four wide until tucked inside half a mile from home, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, offered up a bid but was outkicked. DEVILLY five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and stayed on one paced to the finish. PREDETERMINED broke a beat slow, chased along the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, continued three wide into upper stretch and made no impact. FAST COREY dueled two to three wide down the backstretch with CANDY MONET to her outside, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, yielded the front at that station, was in the midst of being shaken off by her main pace foe a furlong out as rivals advanced outside her when she suddenly ducked in crashing through the temporary rail nearing the sixteenth pole and lost the rider in the process, was apprehended by outrider and walked off under her own power. There was a Stewards' Inquiry into the stretch run focusing on FAST COREY before the result was allowed to stand and the race was declared official.
